main event: Multiple sightings of shiny bright objects over Dayton, Ohio in February 1961, with varying descriptions and durations.
interesting points: The first sighting reported a shiny bright object about three times the size of an automobile headlight, lasting for about 20 minutes., One report described a white light appearing stationary for two minutes before moving slowly out of sight., Observers compared one of the objects to Venus, indicating possible misidentification of celestial bodies., The duration of observations ranged from 1 minute to 20 minutes, indicating varied experiences among witnesses., None of the records contain photographs despite multiple documented sightings.
sighted object: shiny bright object(s) that appeared as lights
witness description: An unidentified individual, presumed to be a civilian with a basic education level.
